intro: Treculia staudtii var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf treculia, is a deciduous tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by large, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed. Its bark is thick and corky, providing some resistance to pests and diseases. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats within forest understories.
